name: Closed Change, Natural to Reverse

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
man.note: Although the amount of turn is given as 'nil', a very slight turn to R may be made.

feet_positions: RF to side and slightly back

follow: Double Reverse Spin (full turn, commenced facing DC)
Double Reverse Spin (underturned, commenced facing DC)
Progressive Chasse to R (3/8 turn, commenced facing DC)
Progressive Chasse to R (1/2 turn, commenced facing DC)
Fallaway Reverse and Slip Pivot (end facing LOD)

name: Closed Change, Reverse to Natural

feet_positions: RF to side and slightly fwd
man.note: Although the amount of turn is given as 'nil', a very slight turn to L may be made.

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly back

precede: Double Reverse Spin (underturned, commenced facing DC)
Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing DW of new LOD)
follow: Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing DW of new LOD)
Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing new LOD)
Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing DC of new LOD)

name: Natural Turn
precede: Basic Weave (at corner, commenced backing LOD)

name: 1-3 Natural Turn
precede: Basic Weave (at corner, commenced backing LOD)
follow: Back Whisk (3/8 turn, end facing DC)

name: 1-3 Natural Turn (underturned)
precede: Basic Weave (at corner, commenced backing LOD)

name: 4-6 Natural Turn (underturned)
precede: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn, end backing DW)

name: 4-6 Natural Turn (at corner, underturned)
precede: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn, end backing DW)

name: 4-6 Natural Turn (underturned, end facing DW)
follow: Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing DW of new LOD)
Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing new LOD)
Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing DC of new LOD)

name: Reverse Turn
precede: Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing DC of new LOD)
Double Reverse Spin (full turn, commenced facing DC)
Reverse Pivot (commenced backing DC, end facing DC)

Double Reverse Spin (full turn, commenced facing DC)
Reverse Pivot (commenced backing DC, end facing DC)

name: 1-3 Reverse Turn (end backing DW)
precede: Hesitation Change (at corner, end facing new LOD)

name: 4-6 Reverse Turn (underturned)
precede: Outside Spin (1/2 turn, commenced backing DW against LOD)
Outside Spin (3/4 turn, commenced backing DW)

name: 4-6 Reverse Turn (underturned, end facing DC)
follow: Double Reverse Spin (full turn, commenced facing DC)
Double Reverse Spin (underturned, commenced facing DC)
Progressive Chasse to R (3/8 turn, commenced facing DC)
Progressive Chasse to R (1/2 turn, commenced facing DC)
Fallaway Reverse and Slip Pivot (end facing LOD)

name: Natural Spin Turn

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet_positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note: The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact with the floor.

precede: Basic Weave (at corner, commenced backing LOD)
follow: Reverse Pivot (commenced backing DC, end facing DW)
Reverse Pivot (commenced backing DC, end facing LOD)
Reverse Pivot (commenced backing DC, end facing DC)
Basic Weave (at corner, end in PP)

name: Natural Spin Turn (underturned)

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet_positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note: The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact with the floor.

precede: Basic Weave (at corner, commenced backing LOD)
follow: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn, end backing DW)

name: Natural Spin Turn (at corner)

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly back
man.note: Although the footwork on step 4 is THT the heel is in contact with the floor during the actual turn.

feet_positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note: The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact with the floor.

feet_positions: LF back and slightly to side
RF diag fwd having brushed to LF
lady.note: The rise is taken from the ball of LF on step 5, and it is important to note that as the RF commences to move to brush to LF the ball of RF not the heel is in contact with the floor.

follow: Hover Corte (using extra bar of music)
Hover Corte (at corner, using extra bar of music)

name: Whisk

feet_positions: RF to side and slightly fwd
LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: The position of step 2 is consistent with step 2 of a Closed Change.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP
lady.note: The feet complete the turn between 1-2.

RF closes to LF without weight

RF closes to LF without weight

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly fwd

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
RF to side and slightly back

feet_positions: RF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
LF fwd and across in PP and CBMP

feet_positions: RF fwd and across in PP and CBMP
LF fwd and across in PP and CBMP

precede: Hover Corte (using extra bar of music)

feet_positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

feet_positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the man.

feet_positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

feet_positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

name: Reverse Corte (1/4 turn)

feet_positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the Man.

precede: Outside Spin (3/4 turn, commenced backing DW)
Outside Spin (1/2 turn, commenced backing DW against LOD)

name: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn, end backing DW)

feet_positions: LF closes to RF without weight
man.note: On step 2 turn may be made on ball of RF with foot flat. Footwork would then be: 1 THT; 2 T (both feet); 3 TH (RF).

lady.note: Lady commences to rise slightly earlier than the man.

follow: Back Whisk (1/4 turn, end facing DC)
Outside Spin (3/4 turn, commenced backing DW)

name: Back Whisk

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

precede: Hover Corte (using extra bar of music)

name: Back Whisk (end facing LOD)

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

follow: Weave from PP (commenced facing LOD, end in PP)

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP
LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP
LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

name: Back Whisk (at corner, 1/4 turn)

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

precede: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn, end backing DW)
Progressive Chasse to R (commenced facing LOD)

name: Back Whisk (1/4 turn, end facing DC)

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

precede: Reverse Corte (1/2 turn, end backing DW)

name: Back Whisk (3/8 turn)

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

name: Back Whisk (3/8 turn, end facing DC)

feet_positions: LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP
LF crosses behind RF in PP
man.note: It is permissible for the man to commence to draw the LF back with the Toe or Heel in contact with the floor when moving back to cross behind RF on step 3.

feet_positions: RF crosses behind LF in PP

name: Basic Weave

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
RF to side and slightly back
lady.note: More advanced lady dancers may, if they wish, use ball of foot to whole foot on step 1 of this figure.

Outside Spin (1/2 turn, commenced backing DW against LOD)

feet_positions: LF to side and slightly fwd
man.note: It is better to commence facing LOD for the 3 steps of the Reverse Turn preceding this figure. Amount of turn can also be 1/4, 1/8, 1/4.

feet_positions: RF to side and slightly back
lady.note: More advanced lady dancers may, if they wish, use ball of foot to whole foot on step 1 of this figure.

feet_positions: RF fwd fwd and across in PP and CBMP
LF fwd and across in PP and CBMP

Facing DC moving along new LOD
